The Data Source Toolbar


Figure 1. The Data Source Toolbar


Toolbar option

Allows you to

For more information

 Database Administration

Manage MySQL connection profiles.

See Database Administration

Data Connection: The Data Source List

This displays the available data sources. The default is 'Derby: Default'. If you set up any MySQL connection profiles, then these profile names will also be displayed in the drop down menu for you to choose to switch to. Note: Any open project will be closed before switching data sources.

See Database Administration
Refresh local data Reload the locally viewed data from the database. It is part of the new group working functionality and is only available when connected to a remote MySQL database. Effectively, it will repaint the maps and lists with the latest database data, which will display any new nodes added by other users. see Group Working
Refresh interval

This menu lets you set a refresh interval when using the auto-refresh system, (see below). It is part of the new group working functionality and is only available when connected to a remote MySQL database.

 see Group Working
Auto Refresh Start/Stop

This button allows you to start and stop the auto-refreshing of the local data. It is part of the new group working functionality and is only available when connected to a remote MySQL database.

This effectively does the same thing as the above refresh local data button mentioned above, but on a timer. So it will automatically keep refreshing the data you see allowing you to see any new nodes added by other remote users.

This is best kept on higher interval settings, and can have a few interface side-effects if you are in the middle of creating a node, say, when the refresh runs. It is a work in progress to help facility group working.

see Group Working
